revised_title: James Frederic Danielli: A Pioneering Biophysicist and Cell Biologist
tldr: James Frederic Danielli was a prominent biophysicist and cell biologist known for his contributions to understanding cell membranes and permeability. He developed the paucimolecular model for the cell membrane and, with Hugh Davson, proposed the theory of facilitated transport. Danielli's work in cell biology and his involvement in political movements during his lifetime are highlighted in this biographical memoir.
